page.title: 06PLACE NAMES OF THE FEN EDGE
page.content: {Chalk Farm}and{Spring Hall}take their names from local physical features. {Four Mile Stable Farm}is situated by the old wooden post which marks a distance of four miles to the finish of Newmarket racecourse. The old course is no longer visible but was a continuation of what is now the Beacon Course. {Hare Park's}name dates back to the late seventeenth century and the reign of King Charles 11, when a rectangular area covering about 25 acres was enclosed by an earth rampart two feet high and topped with a wooden stockade. This was a warren in which hares were kept in order to provide food during the winter months when fresh meat was scarce.
